content.question: Cory has a small role in the school’s upcoming theater production. Cory has memorized his lines and knows his role well. On the first night of performances, Cory notices that the auditorium is full and the audience is enthusiastic. How is social facilitation likely to affect Cory’s performance in front of the audience?

choices.label: Cory will probably do better during the performance than he did during rehearsal.
Cory will probably do worse during the performance than he did during rehearsal.
Cory will probably put forth less effort during the performance than he does during rehearsal and will rely on other cast members to work harder.
Cory will be likely to attribute a bad performance to aspects of the situation rather than to his own preparation.

content.answer: Cory will probably do better during the performance than he did during rehearsal.

skill.text: 1.A: Apply psychological perspectives, theories, concepts, and research findings to a scenario.
